text: now i would like you to help me out by essentially write "objective reviews" of tools and commands i have a lot of and try to help me see use-cases and how we can best take them into our workflow
The user wants me to help

options.label: Everything

options.label: CLI tools & scripts

text: Interrupted Â· What should Claude do instead?
cnt sat ant rnt lnt snt vnt znt bp int knt cpnt svnt ncp qps cad

input.command: for cmd in cnt sat ant rnt lnt snt vnt znt bp int knt cpnt svnt ncp qps cad; do echo "=== $cmd ==="; type "$cmd" 2>/dev/null || echo "not found"; which "$cmd" 2>/dev/null; echo; done
input.description: Check what each command is (alias, function, binary)

input.command: for cmd in cnt sat ant rnt lnt snt vnt znt bp int knt cpnt svnt ncp qps cad; do path=$(which "$cmd" 2>/dev/null); if [ -n "$path" ]; then echo "=== $cmd ($path) ==="; file "$path"; head -5 "$path" 2>/dev/null; echo; fi; done
input.description: Get file type and first lines of each command

Output too large (36.8KB). Full output saved to: /skogai/config/claude/projects/-home-skogix-claude/7ad30fd4-0b11-4c60-9df1-33106cae4aed/tool-results/b132ed4.txt

Preview (first 2KB):
NTM (Named Tmux Manager) helps you create and manage tmux sessions
with multiple AI coding agents (Claude, Codex, Gemini) in separate panes.

Quick Start:
  ntm spawn myproject --cc=2 --cod=2    # Create session with 4 agents
  ntm attach myproject                   # Attach to session
  ntm palette                            # Open command palette (TUI)
  ntm send myproject --all "fix bugs"   # Broadcast prompt to all agents

Shell Integration:
  Add to your .zshrc:  eval "$(ntm shell zsh)"
  Add to your .bashrc: eval "$(ntm shell bash)"

Usage:
  ntm [flags]
  ntm [command]

Available Commands:
  activity             Show agent activity states in a session
  add                  Add more agents to an existing session
  adopt                Adopt an external tmux session for NTM management
  agents               Manage agent profiles and capabilities
  analytics            View session analytics and statistics
  approve              Manage approval requests for dangerous operations
  assign               Intelligently assign work to agents based on BV triage
  attach               Attach to a tmux session
  beads                Manage the beads (bd) daemon for issue tracking sync
  bind                 Set up tmux keybinding for command palette
  bugs                 View and manage UBS (Ultimate Bug Scanner) findings
  cass                 Interact with CASS (Coding Agent Session Search)
  changes              Show recent file changes attributed to agents
  checkpoint           Manage session checkpoints
  cleanup              Clean up stale NTM temporary files and directories
  completion           Generate shell completion script
  config               Manage configuration
  conflicts            Show potential file conflicts between agents
  context              Manage context packs for agent tasks
  controller           Launch a dedicated controller agent in pane 1
  coordinator          Manage session coordination for multi-agent workflows
...
</persisted-output>

   120â†’Flags:
   121â†’      --activity-type string            Filter by agent type: claude, codex, gemini. Optional with --robot-activity. Example: --activity-type=claude
   122â†’      --agent string                    Filter by agent type: claude, codex, gemini, cursor, etc.
   123â†’      --agents string                   Agent mix for ensemble spawn (e.g., cc=2,cod=1,gmi=1)
   124â†’      --alert-threshold string          Provider usage % for ALERT level. Optional with --robot-monitor. Example: --alert-threshold=80 (default 80)
   125â†’      --all                             Include user pane (default: agents only). Optional with --robot-send, --robot-interrupt
   126â†’      --allocation string               Explicit pane->bead allocation JSON. Alternative to --from-bv. Example: --allocation='{"2":"bd-abc"}'
   127â†’      --allow-advanced                  Allow advanced/experimental modes with --robot-ensemble-spawn
   128â†’      --allow-secret                    Bypass 'block' mode for this invocation (use with caution)
   129â†’      --any                             Match ANY instead of ALL
   130â†’      --assignee string                 Filter by assignee
   131â†’      --assignment string               Assignment strategy for ensemble spawn: round-robin, affinity, category, explicit (default "affinity")
   132â†’      --background                      Run in background
   133â†’      --bead-assignee string            Assignee for claim. Optional with --robot-bead-claim
   134â†’      --bead-close-reason string        Reason for closing. Optional with --robot-bead-close
   135â†’      --bead-depends-on string          Comma-separated dependency bead IDs. Optional with --robot-bead-create
   136â†’      --bead-description string         Description for new bead. Optional with --robot-bead-create
   137â†’      --bead-labels string              Comma-separated labels. Optional with --robot-bead-create. Example: --bead-labels=backend,api
   138â†’      --bead-priority int               Priority 0-4 (0=critical, 4=backlog). Optional with --robot-bead-create (default 2)
   139â†’      --bead-title string               Title for new bead. Required with --robot-bead-create
   140â†’      --bead-type string                Type: task, bug, feature, epic, chore. Optional with --robot-bead-create (default "task")
   141â†’      --beads string                    Specific bead IDs to assign (comma-separated). Optional with --robot-assign. Example: --beads=ntm-abc,ntm-xyz
   142â†’      --brief                           Minimal output (summary only)
   143â†’      --budget-per-agent int            Override per-agent token cap for ensemble spawn
   144â†’      --budget-total int                Override total token budget for ensemble spawn
   145â†’      --bundle-format string            Archive format: zip or tar.gz. Optional with --robot-support-bundle (default "zip")
   146â†’      --bundle-lines int                Max scrollback lines per pane. Optional with --robot-support-bundle. Example: --bundle-lines=500 (default 1000)
   147â†’      --bundle-max-size int             Max bundle size in MB. Optional with --robot-support-bundle. Example: --bundle-max-size=50 (default 100)
   148â†’      --bundle-output string            Output file path for bundle. Optional with --robot-support-bundle. Example: --bundle-output=/tmp/debug.zip
   149â†’      --bundle-redact string            Redaction mode: off, warn, redact, block. Optional with --robot-support-bundle (default "redact")
   150â†’      --bundle-since string             Include content from duration ago. Optional with --robot-support-bundle. Example: --bundle-since=1h
   151â†’      --category string                 Filter by category
   152â†’      --cmd string                      DEPRECATED: use --command
   153â†’      --code                            Parse code blocks from output
   154â†’      --command string                  Command to preflight with --robot-dcg-check / --robot-guard (no execution). Example: --command='rm -rf /tmp'
   155â†’      --compact                         Ultra-compact output format
   156â†’      --condition string                Alias for --wait-until. Wait condition: idle, complete, generating, healthy (default "idle")
   157â†’      --config string                   config file (default ~/.config/ntm/config.toml)
   158â†’      --controller-agent-type string    Agent type for controller: cc, cod, gmi. Use with --robot-controller-spawn (default "cc")
   159â†’      --controller-no-prompt            Skip initial prompt. Use with --robot-controller-spawn
   160â†’      --controller-prompt string        Custom prompt file. Use with --robot-controller-spawn
   161â†’      --crit-threshold string           Context % for CRITICAL level. Optional with --robot-monitor. Example: --crit-threshold=15 (default 15)
   162â†’      --days int                        Number of days to analyze (default 30)
   163â†’      --delay-ms int                    Delay between sends (ms). Optional with --robot-send. Example: --delay-ms=500 for 0.5s between panes
   164â†’      --dry-run                         Preview mode: show what would happen without executing. Use with --robot-send, --robot-interrupt, --robot-spawn, --robot-restore, --robot-restart-pane
   165â†’      --enter                           Send Enter after pasting message (default: true). Use --enter=false to paste without submitting (default true)
   166â†’      --errors-since string             Filter to errors from last duration. Optional with --robot-errors. Example: --errors-since=5m
   167â†’      --exclude string                  Exclude pane indices (comma-separated). Optional with --robot-send. Example: --exclude=0,3
   168â†’      --exit-on-error                   Alias for --wait-exit-on-error. Exit immediately if ERROR state detected
   169â†’      --fix                             Attempt auto-fix for fixable issues
   170â†’      --force                           DANGEROUS: Force restart even if agent is working. Optional with --robot-smart-restart. Use with extreme caution!

   172â†’      --full                            Show full help with all commands (default behavior)
   173â†’      --group-by string                 Grouping: agent, model, day, week, month (default "agent")
   174â†’  -h, --help                            help for ntm
   175â†’      --id string                       Entry ID for replay

   181â†’      --json                            Output in JSON format (machine-readable)
   182â†’      --last int                        Show last N entries
   183â†’      --limit int                       Max results to return (default varies by command) (default 10)

   185â†’      --logs-limit int                  Max lines per pane. Use with --robot-logs. Example: --logs-limit=50 (default 100)

   189â†’      --mail-project string             Project for mail check. Required with --robot-mail-check. Example: --mail-project=myproject
   190â†’      --mail-status string              Filter by read status: read, unread, all. Optional with --robot-mail-check. Example: --mail-status=unread
   191â†’      --mail-until string               Filter to messages before date (YYYY-MM-DD). Optional with --robot-mail-check. Example: --mail-until=2025-12-31
   192â†’      --mail-verbose                    Include extra details in output. Optional with --robot-mail-check
   193â†’      --max-alerts int                  Max alerts to show
   194â†’      --max-beads int                   Max beads to show
   195â†’      --minimal                         Show minimal help with essential commands only (spawn, send, status, kill, help)

   197â†’      --msg string                      Message content to send. Required with --robot-send unless --msg-file is set. Optional with --robot-ack (enables echo detection)
   198â†’      --msg-file string                 Read message content from file (use with --robot-send)
   199â†’      --no-cache                        Bypass context cache for ensemble spawn
   200â†’      --no-caut                         Skip caut provider query for faster local-only health check. Optional with --robot-agent-health
   201â†’      --no-color                        Disable colored output
   202â†’      --no-questions                    Skip targeted questions during ensemble spawn (future)
   203â†’      --no-wait                         Return immediately without waiting
   204â†’      --offset int                      Pagination offset (default 0)
   205â†’      --output string                   Output file path for JSONL. Optional with --robot-monitor. Example: --output=/tmp/monitor.jsonl
   206â†’      --pane string                     Filter by pane ID. Optional with --robot-history and --robot-switch-account
   207â†’      --panes string                    Filter to specific pane indices. Optional with --robot-tail, --robot-errors, --robot-send, --robot-ack, --robot-interrupt, --robot-is-working. Example: --panes=1,2
   208â†’      --period string                   Time period: 1h, 24h, 7d, all (default "24h")
   209â†’      --poll string                     Polling interval (default "2s")
   210â†’      --preset string                   Ensemble preset name. Required with --robot-ensemble-spawn unless --modes is set

   212â†’      --probe-aggressive                Fallback to interrupt_test if keystroke_echo fails (used with --robot-probe)
   213â†’      --probe-method string             Probe method: keystroke_echo, interrupt_test (used with --robot-probe)
   214â†’      --probe-timeout int               Probe timeout in ms (100-60000, used with --robot-probe)
   215â†’      --profile-startup                 Enable startup profiling (outputs timing data)
   216â†’      --project string                  Project directory override for ensemble spawn
   217â†’      --prompt string                   Send this prompt to the agent after restart. Optional with --robot-smart-restart
   218â†’      --provider string                 Filter by provider: claude, openai, google
   219â†’      --question string                 Question for ensemble spawn. Required with --robot-ensemble-spawn
   220â†’      --rano-window string              Time window for --robot-rano-stats (e.g., 5m, 1h) (default "5m")
   221â†’      --redact string                   Redaction mode override: off, warn, redact, block
   222â†’      --restart-bead string             Assign bead to agent after restart. Fetches info via br show --json, sends prompt. Use with --robot-restart-pane. Example: --restart-bead=bd-abc12
   223â†’      --restart-prompt string           Custom prompt to send after restart. Overrides --restart-bead template. Use with --robot-restart-pane
   224â†’      --robot-account-status            Show CAAM account status per provider. JSON output. Example: ntm --robot-account-status
   225â†’      --robot-accounts-list             List all CAAM accounts. JSON output. Example: ntm --robot-accounts-list
   226â†’      --robot-ack string                Watch for agent responses after send. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-ack=proj --ack-timeout=30s
   227â†’      --robot-activity string           Get agent activity state (idle/busy/error). Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-activity=myproject
   228â†’      --robot-agent-health string       Comprehensive agent health check combining local state and provider usage. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-agent-health=myproject --panes=2,3
   229â†’      --robot-alerts                    List active alerts with filtering. TUI parity for Alerts panel. Example: ntm --robot-alerts --alerts-severity=critical
   230â†’      --robot-assign string             Get work distribution recommendations. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-assign=proj --strategy=speed
   231â†’      --robot-bead-claim string         Claim a bead by ID. Example: ntm --robot-bead-claim=ntm-abc123
   232â†’      --robot-bead-close string         Close a bead by ID. Example: ntm --robot-bead-close=ntm-abc123
   233â†’      --robot-bead-create               Create a new bead. Requires --bead-title. Example: ntm --robot-bead-create --bead-title='Fix bug'
   234â†’      --robot-bead-show string          Show bead details. Example: ntm --robot-bead-show=ntm-abc123
   235â†’      --robot-beads-list                List beads with filtering. TUI parity for Beads panel. Example: ntm --robot-beads-list --beads-status=open
   236â†’      --robot-bulk-assign string        Bulk assign beads to all idle agents. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-bulk-assign=proj --from-bv
   237â†’      --robot-capabilities              Get all available robot commands with parameters and descriptions (JSON). Machine-discoverable API
   238â†’      --robot-cass-context string       Get relevant past context for a task. Example: ntm --robot-cass-context='how to implement auth'
   239â†’      --robot-cass-insights             Get CASS aggregated insights: topics, patterns, agent activity (JSON)
   240â†’      --robot-cass-search string        Search past agent conversations. Required: QUERY. Example: ntm --robot-cass-search='authentication error'
   241â†’      --robot-cass-status               Get CASS health: index status, message counts, freshness (JSON)
   242â†’      --robot-context string            Get context window usage for all agents in a session. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-context=myproject
   243â†’      --robot-controller-spawn string   Launch controller agent in session. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-controller-spawn=proj
   244â†’      --robot-dashboard                 Get dashboard summary as markdown (or JSON with --json). Token-efficient overview
   245â†’      --robot-dcg-check                 Preflight a shell command via dcg (no execution). JSON output. Requires --command.
   246â†’      --robot-dcg-status                Show DCG status and configuration. JSON output. Example: ntm --robot-dcg-status
   247â†’      --robot-diagnose string           Comprehensive health check with fix recommendations. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-diagnose=myproject
   248â†’      --robot-diff string               Compare agent activity and file changes. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-diff=myproject --diff-since=10m
   249â†’      --robot-dismiss-alert string      Dismiss an alert by ID. Example: ntm --robot-dismiss-alert=alert-abc123
   250â†’      --robot-docs string               Get documentation for a topic (JSON). Topics: quickstart, commands, examples, exit-codes. Example: ntm --robot-docs=quickstart
   251â†’      --robot-ensemble string           Get ensemble state for a session. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-ensemble=myproject
   252â†’      --robot-ensemble-modes            List reasoning modes (JSON). Optional: --tier, --category, --limit, --offset
   253â†’      --robot-ensemble-presets          List ensemble presets (JSON). Example: ntm --robot-ensemble-presets
   254â†’      --robot-ensemble-spawn string     Spawn a reasoning ensemble. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-ensemble-spawn=myproject --preset=project-diagnosis --question='...'
   255â†’      --robot-ensemble-stop string      Stop an ensemble and save partial state. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-ensemble-stop=myproject
   256â†’      --robot-ensemble-suggest string   Suggest best ensemble preset for a question. Example: ntm --robot-ensemble-suggest="What security issues exist?"
   257â†’      --robot-env string                Environment info for agent operation. Pass session name or 'global'. JSON output. Example: ntm --robot-env=myproject
   258â†’      --robot-errors string             Filter pane output to show only errors. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-errors=myproject --lines=100
   259â†’      --robot-file-beads string         Get beads that touched a file path. Required: FILE_PATH. Example: ntm --robot-file-beads=src/main.go
   260â†’      --robot-file-hotspots             Get files touched by most beads (quality hotspots) (JSON)
   261â†’      --robot-file-relations string     Get files that co-change with given file. Required: FILE_PATH. Example: ntm --robot-file-relations=src/api.go
   262â†’      --robot-files string              Get file changes with agent attribution. Optional SESSION filter. Example: ntm --robot-files=myproject --files-window=15m
   263â†’      --robot-forecast string           Get ETA predictions. Use 'all' or specific ID. Example: ntm --robot-forecast=br-123
   264â†’      --robot-format string             Output format for robot commands: json (default), toon (token-efficient), or auto. Env: NTM_ROBOT_FORMAT, NTM_OUTPUT_FORMAT, TOON_DEFAULT_FORMAT
   265â†’      --robot-graph                     Get bv dependency graph insights: PageRank, critical path, cycles (JSON)
   266â†’      --robot-guard                     DEPRECATED: use --robot-dcg-check
   267â†’      --robot-health string             Get session or project health (JSON). SESSION for per-agent health, empty for project health. Example: ntm --robot-health=myproject
   268â†’      --robot-health-oauth string       Get per-agent OAuth and rate-limit status (JSON). Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-health-oauth=myproject
   269â†’      --robot-help                      Show comprehensive AI agent integration guide with examples (JSON)
   270â†’      --robot-history string            Get command history for a session (JSON). Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-history=myproject
   271â†’      --robot-impact string             Get file impact analysis. Required: FILE_PATH. Example: ntm --robot-impact=src/main.go
   272â†’      --robot-inspect-pane string       Detailed pane inspection. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-inspect-pane=myproject --inspect-index=1
   273â†’      --robot-interrupt string          Send Ctrl+C to stop agents, optionally send new task. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-interrupt=proj --interrupt-msg='Stop and fix bug'
   274â†’      --robot-is-working string         Check if agents are working. Returns work state with recommendations. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-is-working=myproject --panes=2,3
   275â†’      --robot-jfp-bundles               List all prompt bundles (JSON)
   276â†’      --robot-jfp-categories            List all prompt categories with counts (JSON)
   277â†’      --robot-jfp-installed             List installed Claude Code skills (JSON)
   278â†’      --robot-jfp-list                  List all prompts from JeffreysPrompts registry (JSON)
   279â†’      --robot-jfp-search string         Search prompts. Required: QUERY. Example: ntm --robot-jfp-search='debugging'
   280â†’      --robot-jfp-show string           Show prompt details. Required: ID. Example: ntm --robot-jfp-show='prompt-123'
   281â†’      --robot-jfp-status                Get JFP health: installation status, registry connectivity (JSON)
   282â†’      --robot-jfp-suggest string        Get prompt suggestions for a task. Required: TASK. Example: ntm --robot-jfp-suggest='build a REST API'
   283â†’      --robot-jfp-tags                  List all prompt tags with counts (JSON)
   284â†’      --robot-label-attention           Get attention-ranked labels by impact and urgency (JSON)
   285â†’      --robot-label-flow                Get cross-label dependency flow matrix and bottleneck analysis (JSON)
   286â†’      --robot-label-health              Get per-label health analysis: velocity, staleness, blocked count (JSON)
   287â†’      --robot-limit int                 Max items to return for robot list outputs (status, snapshot, history). Example: --robot-limit=10
   288â†’      --robot-logs string               Get aggregated logs from all agent panes (JSON). Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-logs=myproject
   289â†’      --robot-mail                      Get Agent Mail inbox/outbox state (JSON). Shows pending messages and coordination status
   290â†’      --robot-mail-check                Check agent inboxes via Agent Mail. Requires --mail-project. JSON output. Example: ntm --robot-mail-check --mail-project=myproject
   291â†’      --robot-markdown                  System state as markdown tables. LLM-friendly, ~50% fewer tokens than JSON
   292â†’      --robot-metrics string            Session metrics export. Optional SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-metrics=myproject --metrics-period=24h
   293â†’      --robot-monitor string            Start proactive monitoring for usage limits. Emits JSONL warnings. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-monitor=myproject --interval=30s
   294â†’      --robot-ms-search string          Search Meta Skill catalog. Required: QUERY. Example: ntm --robot-ms-search='commit workflow'
   295â†’      --robot-ms-show string            Show Meta Skill details. Required: ID. Example: ntm --robot-ms-show='commit-and-release'
   296â†’      --robot-offset int                Pagination offset for robot list outputs (status, snapshot, history). Example: --robot-offset=20
   297â†’      --robot-palette                   Query palette commands. Example: ntm --robot-palette --palette-category=quick
   298â†’      --robot-pipeline string           Get pipeline status. Required: RUN_ID. Example: ntm --robot-pipeline=run-20241230-123456-abcd
   299â†’      --robot-pipeline-cancel string    Cancel a running pipeline. Required: RUN_ID. Example: ntm --robot-pipeline-cancel=run-20241230-123456-abcd
   300â†’      --robot-pipeline-list             List all tracked pipelines. Example: ntm --robot-pipeline-list
   301â†’      --robot-pipeline-run string       Run a workflow. Required: WORKFLOW_FILE, --pipeline-session. Example: ntm --robot-pipeline-run=workflow.yaml --pipeline-session=proj
   302â†’      --robot-plan                      Get bv execution plan with parallelizable tracks (JSON). Example: ntm --robot-plan
   303â†’      --robot-probe string              Probe pane responsiveness. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-probe=proj --panes=1,2
   304â†’      --robot-quota-check               Check quota for specific provider. JSON output. Example: ntm --robot-quota-check --quota-check-provider=claude
   305â†’      --robot-quota-status              Show caut quota status for all providers. JSON output. Example: ntm --robot-quota-status
   306â†’      --robot-rano-stats                Get per-agent network stats via rano. JSON output. Example: ntm --robot-rano-stats
   307â†’      --robot-rch-status                Get RCH status summary (JSON). Example: ntm --robot-rch-status
   308â†’      --robot-rch-workers               List RCH workers (JSON). Example: ntm --robot-rch-workers
   309â†’      --robot-recipes                   List available spawn recipes/presets (JSON). Use with --robot-spawn --spawn-preset
   310â†’      --robot-replay string             Replay command from history. Required: SESSION. Use with --replay-id. Example: ntm --robot-replay=myproject --replay-id=1735830245123-a1b2c3d4
   311â†’      --robot-restart-pane string       Restart pane process (kill and respawn). Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-restart-pane=proj --panes=1,2
   312â†’      --robot-restore string            Restore session from saved state. Required: path to save file. Example: ntm --robot-restore=backup.json
   313â†’      --robot-route string              Get routing recommendation. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-route=myproject --route-strategy=least-loaded
   314â†’      --robot-ru-sync                   Run ru sync with JSON output. Optional with --dry-run. Example: ntm --robot-ru-sync
   315â†’      --robot-save string               Save session state for later restore. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-save=proj --save-output=backup.json
   316â†’      --robot-schema string             Generate JSON Schema for response types. Required: TYPE (status, send, spawn, interrupt, tail, ack, snapshot, ensemble, ensemble_spawn, all)
   317â†’      --robot-search string             Semantic vector search. Required: QUERY. Example: ntm --robot-search='authentication bug'
   318â†’      --robot-send string               Send message to panes atomically. Required: SESSION, --msg or --msg-file. Example: ntm --robot-send=proj --msg='Fix auth'
   319â†’      --robot-smart-restart string      SAFE restart: checks --robot-is-working first, refuses to interrupt working agents. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-smart-restart=myproject --panes=2,3
   320â†’      --robot-snapshot                  Unified state: sessions + beads + alerts + mail. Use --since for delta. Example: ntm --robot-snapshot
   321â†’      --robot-spawn string              Create session with agents. Required: SESSION name. Example: ntm --robot-spawn=myproject --spawn-cc=2
   322â†’      --robot-status                    Get tmux sessions, panes, agent states. Start here. Example: ntm --robot-status
   323â†’      --robot-suggest                   Get hygiene suggestions: duplicates, missing deps, label suggestions (JSON)
   324â†’      --robot-summary string            Get session activity summary with agent metrics. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-summary=myproject --summary-since=30m
   325â†’      --robot-support-bundle string     Generate support bundle with diagnostic info. Optional: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-support-bundle=myproject
   326â†’      --robot-switch-account string     Switch CAAM account for provider. Format: provider or provider:account. Example: ntm --robot-switch-account=claude
   327â†’      --robot-tail string               Capture recent pane output. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-tail=myproject --lines=50
   328â†’      --robot-terse                     Single-line state: S:session|A:ready/total|W:working|I:idle|B:beads|M:mail|!:alerts. Minimal tokens
   329â†’      --robot-tokens                    Get token usage statistics (JSON). Group by agent, model, or time period
   330â†’      --robot-tools                     Get tool inventory with health status (JSON). Shows all registered flywheel tools
   331â†’      --robot-triage                    Get bv triage analysis with recommendations, quick wins, blockers (JSON). Example: ntm --robot-triage --triage-limit=20
   332â†’      --robot-verbosity string          Robot verbosity profile for JSON/TOON: terse, default, or debug. Env: NTM_ROBOT_VERBOSITY
   333â†’      --robot-version                   Get ntm version, commit, build info (JSON). Example: ntm --robot-version
   334â†’      --robot-wait string               Wait for agents to reach state. Required: SESSION. Example: ntm --robot-wait=myproject --wait-until=idle
   335â†’      --schema string                   Alias for --robot-schema. Generate JSON Schema for response types
   336â†’      --search string                   Search query for palette commands
   337â†’      --sections string                 Include only specific sections
   338â†’      --severity string                 Filter by severity: info, warning, error, critical
   339â†’      --since string                    RFC3339 timestamp for delta snapshot. Optional with --robot-snapshot. Example: --since=2025-12-15T10:00:00Z
   340â†’      --skip string                     Pane indices to skip (comma-separated)
   341â†’      --spawn-assign-work               Enable orchestrator work assignment: get bv triage, claim beads, send work prompts to agents
   342â†’      --spawn-cc int                    Claude Code agents to spawn. Use with --robot-spawn. Example: --spawn-cc=2
   343â†’      --spawn-cod int                   Codex CLI agents to spawn. Use with --robot-spawn. Example: --spawn-cod=1
   344â†’      --spawn-dir string                Working directory for spawned session. Use with --robot-spawn. Example: --spawn-dir=/path/to/project
   345â†’      --spawn-gmi int                   Gemini CLI agents to spawn. Use with --robot-spawn. Example: --spawn-gmi=1
   346â†’      --spawn-no-user                   Skip user pane creation. Optional with --robot-spawn. For headless/automation
   347â†’      --spawn-preset string             Use recipe preset instead of counts. See --robot-recipes. Example: --spawn-preset=standard
   348â†’      --spawn-safety                    Fail if session already exists. Prevents accidental reuse of existing sessions
   349â†’      --spawn-wait                      Wait for agents to show ready state before returning. Recommended for automation
   350â†’      --ssh string                      Remote host for SSH execution (e.g. user@host)
   351â†’      --stats                           Show statistics instead of entries
   352â†’      --status string                   Filter by status: open, in_progress, closed, blocked
   353â†’      --stop-force                      Force kill without graceful shutdown. Optional with --robot-ensemble-stop
   354â†’      --stop-no-collect                 Skip partial output collection. Optional with --robot-ensemble-stop
   355â†’      --strategy string                 Assignment strategy: balanced (default), speed, quality, dependency. Optional with --robot-assign (default "balanced")
   356â†’      --submit                          Alias for --enter (default true)
   357â†’      --suggest-id-only                 Output only preset name with --robot-ensemble-suggest
   358â†’      --tag string                      Filter by tag
   359â†’      --template string                 Custom prompt template file
   360â†’      --thread string                   Filter to specific thread. Optional with --robot-mail-check. Example: --thread=TKT-api-design
   361â†’      --threshold float                 Correlation threshold (0.0-1.0) (default 0.5)
   362â†’      --tier string                     Filter by tier: core, advanced, experimental, all (used with --robot-ensemble-modes)
   363â†’      --timeout string                  Maximum wait/operation timeout (default "5m")
   364â†’      --track                           Combined send+ack: send --msg and wait for response. Use with --robot-send. Example: ntm --robot-send=proj --msg='hello' --track
   365â†’      --transition                      Alias for --wait-transition
   366â†’      --type string                     Filter by agent type: claude|cc, codex|cod, gemini|gmi, cursor, windsurf, aider. Works with --robot-send, --robot-ack, --robot-interrupt
   367â†’      --urgent-only                     Only show urgent/high-priority messages. Optional with --robot-mail-check
   368â†’      --vars string                     JSON variables for pipeline
   369â†’      --verbose                         Include detailed/verbose output
   370â†’      --wait-exit-on-error              Exit immediately if ERROR state detected. Optional with --robot-wait
   371â†’      --wait-transition                 Require state transition: agents must leave then return to target state. Use after sending prompts to wait for complete processing cycle. Optional with --robot-wait
   372â†’      --wait-until string               Wait condition: idle, complete, generating, healthy. Optional with --robot-wait. Example: --wait-until=idle (default "idle")
   373â†’      --warn-threshold string           Context % for WARNING level. Optional with --robot-monitor. Example: --warn-threshold=25 (default 25)
   374â†’      --window string                   Time window: 5m, 15m, 1h, all (default "15m")
   375â†’      --worker string                   Filter to a specific RCH worker by name. Optional with --robot-rch-workers
   376â†’      --workspace string                Filter by workspace/project path
   377â†’
   378â†’Use "ntm [command] --help" for more information about a command.
   379â†’

input.description: Find any commands starting with cad
